Name: Morning Star: Those Who Remain in the Night Part I
Description: There seems to be a commotion going on in the Old District, with a noblewoman surrounded by a crowd. She looks all too familiar…
QuestDesc: There seems to be a commotion going on in the Old District, with a noblewoman surrounded by a crowd. She looks all too familiar…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, there seems to be trouble over there. The locals have a lady surrounded. We should go take a look before things become physical.

Dialogues.Speaker: Calliope
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've got some nerve coming back to Septimont, Julia. You're not welcome here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, I should've recorded all those flattering things you used to say to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Calliope
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You stained the arena with your dirty tricks. Dragged House Silva's name through the mud!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha! The irony of hearing those words from you. Need me to list every little scandal you've tried to bury?

Dialogues.Speaker: Calliope
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why you... Hey, you there. Gladiator! Are you just going to stand there? Get rid of her this instant!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tch. Weakling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Auntie... No, Lady Julia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Adric? Heh, you have your helmet on. Trying to distance yourself from me in public, are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not at all. You will always be family, Auntie. I just… didn't want to startle you. My face was scarred by a Dark Tide monster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Where's Gillian? Why isn't she with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't tell me that two-faced girl dumped you over a few scars?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gillian is dead. She died protecting the Silva crest. The house banner never fell. She did us proud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Auntie, there are no cowards in House Silva. Even without Lupa, the rest of us can still uphold the House's honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why don't you believe in us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard you risked coming back because your estates outside Septimont were destroyed by the Dark Tide. It's okay, I'll accompany you elsewhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't afford to bring more shame to the House Silva, Auntie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... Hahaha! Who would've thought that the little brat who could barely hold a shield without my help would now be lecturing me about honor...

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hear this. All of you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Julia Silva, will not be leaving Septimont! Mournfell Canyon is my destination, where I shall hunt down the legendary undying monster and reclaim House Silva's honor!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Calliope and anyone else eager to cast me out, you'll have to drag me out of Mournfell Canyon yourselves!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hand me your spear, Adric.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adric
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Auntie, no... It's too dangerous!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough, boy! You said it yourself. There are no cowards in House Silva!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Julia grabs Adric's spear and begins walking towards Mournfell Canyon under the gaze of the crowd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Julia's gone to Mournfell Canyon on her own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Septimontians don't seem to be bothered by it. Letting her go like that is practically a death sentence... What do you think, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: I think she doesn't deserve to die for her crimes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where there's light, there's always shadow. But that's not an excuse to pledge yourself to the dark.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For Septimont to march into a new age, it must cut ties with the mistakes of its past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Am I one of Ragunna's past mistakes, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People need a way to let out their anger. But the Threnodian is too abstract, so they need a face to blame. Julia is their scapegoat.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm more worried about Julia ending up like Medulius than getting herself killed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...{PlayerName}, if I deserved a second chance, then so does Lady Julia, don't you think?
